Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw at least one land habitat (e.g., playground, garden) and one water habitat (e.g., pond, lake) to show where living things exist.
The student can illustrate and label different kinds of plants in each habitat, such as trees, grasses, bushes, and flowering plants.
The student can illustrate and label different animals in each habitat, like lizards, squirrels, ants, fish, and clams.
The student can compare the variety of living things shown in the different habitats through labels or captions.
The student can identify and describe patterns of diversity across the habitats through their drawings.
The student can show how observations from media or firsthand experiences were used to create accurate representations of habitats and their living things.
